page.title: 14SCATTERED HOUSING
page.content: 1THERE IS NO NEW HOUSING BUT MANY OF THE HOUSES IN STANGHOW ARE BRICK BUILT AND OF MODERN DESIGN. TWO BUNGALOWS AT MARGROVE PARK ARE ALSO OF FAIRLY MODERN DESIGN. AT STANGHOW MOST OF THE HOUSES HAVE AN INDIVIDUAL APPEARANCE. THE SCATTERED FARM HOUSES ARE OFTEN OCCUPIED BY PEOPLE WHO DO NOT FARM THE LAND. SOME OF THE FARM HOUSES AT STANGHOW ARE RATHER DILAPIDATED, AND THE HOUSE AT KATERIDDEN IS DERELICT. NEAR THE RESERVOIR AT LOCKWOOD BECK A STONE BUILT COTTAGE IS OCCUPIED BY THE GAME KEEPER, AND THE BUNGALOW BY THE WATER BAILIFF. AT SLAPEWATH THE HOUSES WERE ORIGINALLY BRICK-BUILT RAILWAY COTTAGES AND A STONE BUILT STATIONMASTER'S HOUSE. SOME OF THE FARMHOUSES ARE STONE-BUILT AND OTHERS ARE BRICK-BUILT.
